dimensions: h. 11.5 cm, max. diam. 2.5 cm (4 1/2 x 1 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase, partial gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr.

texts.textentryhtml: Partially purchased from John Khayat by the Museum; partially given to the Museum by Frank Jewett Mather Jr.

In-folded, everted rim; short cylindrical neck; elongated ovoid body; pointed bottom. Two coil handles attached on shoulder and upper part of neck. Body covered with twenty-three horizontal ridges. Blown into a bipartite mold of two vertical sections, the seam visible along the middle of the sides.

bibliography.boilertext: Allen Rosenbaum and Francis F. Jones, Selections from The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: The Art Museum, Princeton University, 1986)
bibliography.citation: Allen Rosenbaum and Francis F. Jones, Selections from The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: The Art Museum, Princeton University, 1986), p. 49 (illus.)

Leroux, 1888-).
bibliography.citation: Louis de Clercq, Joachim Menant and André de Ridder, Collection de Clercq: catalogue méthodique et raisonné: antiquités assyriennes, cylindres orientaux, cachets, briques, bronzes, bas-reliefs, etc., (Paris: Académie des inscriptions & belles-lettres; E. Leroux, 1888-)., Vol. 6: pl. XV; p.(?) 335
